medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive gait ataxia and acral paresthesias.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 month prior to presentation in April 2002, with progressive gait ataxia, acral paresthesias, paroxysms of vertigo, and horizontal diplopia in primary gaze. The patient had a self-limited period of numbness and tingling in his feet for 2 months soon after beginning employment fumigating fruits with methyl bromide.
medical_history.social_history: Occupational exposure to methyl bromide while fumigating fruits for the previous 3 years.
